section.title: hard and hardly
section.sectiontitle: Hard as an adjective means 'firm and difficult to cut or break'.
section.text2a: These plums are too hard to eat.
section.sectiontitle2: Hard as an adverb means 'using a lot of effort or force'.
section.text4a: She had to listen really hard to hear what the old lady was saying.

section.title: hard and hardly
section.sectiontitle: Hardly is an adverb which means 'almost not' or 'very little'.
section.text1a: I hardly know the people in my class.
section.sectiontitle2: Hardly is often used with any(thing / one / where, etc.) and ever.
section.text3a: Hardly anything in this shop costs less than 100 euros.
section.text4a: We hardly ever go out in the evening.
